result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Leek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM Felony Substantial Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (ADDED CHARGE ON AMENDMENT TO CT 1), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay restitution to his agent on behalf of the victim.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Defendant must write an apology letter to the victim and give it to the agent for delivery to the victim.
The defendant is allowed to transfer to Milwaukee County if he gets the new welding job.
Expungment is not appropriate.
No alcohol or controlled substances.  AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a doctors prescription.

Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge and give a sample if he has not already done so.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Robert J Leek in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Jamie McClendon
Preliminary hearing on June 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the bar Kelly's Bleachers.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert J Leek in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Robert J Leek in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
